alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 5:30PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN AND RISING SNOW LEVELS EXPECTED THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR JUNEAU, GLACIER BAY, BARANOF ISLAND, ADMIRALTY ISLAND, AND EASTERN CHICHAGOF ISLAND... An atmospheric river Thursday night through Saturday night will bring very heavy rain, warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and a threat of flooding to Juneau, Sitka, Glacier Bay, eastern Chichagof Island, Admiralty Island, and the rest of Baranof Island. A Flood Watch is now in effect for the region. A short break is possible Thursday before heavy rain starts Thursday night and persists for much of the weekend. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches are possible from Thursday evening through Saturday night. Snow levels are forecast to rise to 3,000 around Juneau and Glacier Bay to 7,000 feet on Baranof Island. Heavy rain along with a melting mountain snowpack will increase the risk of minor flooding issues. Please stay tuned to local updates should further flood bulletins be issued.
